values:
So, my dad passed away on Sunday June 28th.  We had the funeral on Friday July 3rd.
Today is my first day back at work in 2 weeks, and I have to say it feels so strange to be here!
There is still so much to take care of and deal with as far as my dad's stuff, and come to find out, all of my mom's stuff is still there as well.  I guess he didn't want to deal with it at all, so once he emptied her clothes out of the closet that was it.  He left it all for us.  Kind of sad to stumble across all of her things since we thought that was behind us.
The good thing is that he is no longer suffering.  And I do mean suffering, he was in excruciating pain, especially at the end, so I am relieved that he isn't hurting anymore.  Also, he is with my mom and everyone that has gone before, so that's good.
I'm not sure what's next, but I think we're going to be quite busy sorting through everything for weeks and weeks!

I took the day off work yesterday because we had a family meeting at the hospital, with the doctors, to make some decisions about my dad.
Some decisions were smaller and easier to make, some not so much.
First we sat down for a Q&A with the doctor so that we could make an "informed" decision.  I say "informed", but really, there is no way in medicine to say unequivocally if "A" then "B", or in X number of days this will happen, or this won't happen...fact is there is always a chance of recovery, there is always a chance of dying, there is always a chance that the universe will throw you a curve ball, so...how do you decide whether or not to pull the plug?
Start by taking into account the person's wishes.  My dad has a living will and has told us in no uncertain terms that he does not want to be kept alive by artificial means.  But, (there's always a but isn't there?) since he is on dialysis, and has been for some time now, he is technically already being kept alive by artificial means.  If he stops the dialysis he will only last a couple of weeks, if that.  He has been talking about stopping lately.  The problem now is that he is not mentally (or physically) able to make the decision himself, and while almost all of us agree about what needs to be done, not necessarily when, there is one very vocal optimist and one mostly optimist arguing to keep him alive for as long as possible.  Hours and hours of this at the hospital!
In the end we decided, unanimously, that there will be no resuscitation and no ventilator.  For now we will leave the feeding tube in and continue dialysis, but we will move him out of ICU into the regular hospital with the possibility of hospice.  We are meeting again in a few days to evaluate the situation.  I think this is the best we can do for now, but, it totally sucks!  It's amazingly hard to make life or death decisions for someone else!  I have a feeling that my dad will end up taking the decision out of our hands.

Thursday:  Went to the hospital to see my dad after work.  Fortunately my friend and roomie was there to keep me company (and to navigate through the hell they call construction in that area).  One of my brothers was there as well, so we basically chatted while we watched my dad sleep.  He is either sleeping because he's so doped up on painkillers, or awake and screaming in pain (he recently had back surgery).  He has a strep infection that they can't get rid of because none of the antibiotics they've tried are working.  He also had a heart attack on Friday, and they think he had a stroke as well.  I've got to say, things are not looking good!

Friday:  Got up early and started painting.  Went out and chopped up tree limbs, mowed and trimmed the lawn, while the paint dried.  Went inside and painted the second coat of green.  Back outside to clean the garage.  And by clean I mean we took every single thing out of the garage, swept and sprayed it out, put the metal shelves together and put everything back in.  Then, back inside to paint the trim.  Then did some housework.  Hung out for a short time with friends, then painted the second coat of trim.  It was a long, busy day!

Saturday:  Got up early for no good reason.  Cleaned some more, organised boxes etc..  Then my brother and nephew, Apostate_1969 and Donky_Hokey, myself and my roomie went to pick up the heaviest computer desk I've had the pleasure of watching someone else carry!  One of my coworkers bought a new place and let us have it for free, and I must say, it is really nice!  It does take up a bit more space than we wanted, but it also provides quite a bit of extra storage space we didn't know we'd be getting.  It looks great too, so we're happy with it!

Sunday:  Got up early, again for no good reason.  Cleaned some more.  Sat down and actually got some pretty good worldbuilding done.  We spoiled ourselves with lunch at Sizzler, then came home and made Rice Krispie treats to thank the fine folks who helped us move furniture on Saturday.  Went to dinner at my brother's, then came home and started doing laundry.  Managed to get a bit more writing in while working on the laundry before I had to stop and make my lunch for work on Monday.  The laundry finally finished at about midnight, but didn't get folded and put away until this morning because my ass was ready for bed!

I need to go back to work to recover from my weekend!

It really sucks when the phone rings at 2:38 am!  After you get over the initial confusion of "what the hell is that hideous noise?", find the noisy thing and pick it up, you still have to figure out what to do with it.  Finally it registers that it's your brother calling, and if you push that little button thingy you can talk to him, but, do you really want to know why he's calling at this hour?  The answer to that is probably not.

I answered the phone despite my misgivings.  Turns out my dad was moved to the ICU in the middle of the night because he has an infection.  The hospital called my brother and told him to start waking people up.  We didn't need to run to the hospital, but we needed to be ready to run to the hospital.  Yeah, try to get back to sleep after that!  Okay, I did finally fall asleep, just in time for the alarm to wake me, followed by a second phone call letting me know that my dad was doing better.  Still in the ICU, but better.  I have a bad feeling about this.  We've been in the hospital way to much lately!

So now, I'm at work, tired as hell, a little cranky, and a lot worried.  If things get worse my brother will call me at work, and I've warned my supervisors that I might need to leave abruptly.  Hopefully things won't get worse!

Highlights from this week:

Kamikaze, base-jumping spider

Mutant, half-plucked, half-gutted chicken complete with "may or may not be missing parts" notice

Broke my ass on a chair (well, my roomie broke her ass on a chair)

Broke my toes on a witchy box

All of this by Wednesday!

Add to this 4 cats trying to learn to share space in a tiny house (actually, 3 of them are doing great), 2 houses worth of earthly goods all packed in a tiny house, 2 gals whose brains seem to have left for the Bahamas without them...it's a recipe for constant laughter and the occasional swearing, screaming (that would be the spider bit) and a whole lot of hopping!

I needs a vacation!!!

My friend is moving in with me this weekend, and I currently have nowhere for her to live!  Oh crap!!!  I have to pack up everything that is in what will be her room, but first I have to find places elsewhere in the house to put it, so I have to pack up stuff from other rooms, decide what to keep, what to sell and what to store.  I think I will not be getting any sleep from Thursday through Saturday.  I also have to work my ten hours a day, take care of all my usual stuff, cats, house, self, etc..  I've been working almost non-stop on it for several weeks in all my spare time (with the exception of one Saturday night with friends) and I am so damn tired!

I hope I will be ready!  Otherwise I guess we'll just park the moving van and take a trip to Wendover!

After 7 weeks battling the flu from hell, I am happy to say that I am finally starting to feel better!  I am still tired (and cranky...ish) but, I'm not feeling ill!
This is good timing since my best friend is coming for a visit this week!  It sure would suck to be sick for that!
Things are looking up!

Recently I have been thinking about old friends, long gone, but not forgotten.  All of a sudden I have started hearing from old friends!  Some of them I haven't spoken to since high school!  I have decided to make an effort to stay in touch better this time around with these friends, much easier to acheive with the instant communication available these days!
Writing letters has never been my strong suit, but I can zip out a "hi, how are ya'?" email in a few seconds!
Strangley, I have also been having dreams where some of these old friends have shown up...before I heard from them!
Things that make you go hmmm...
Kind of makes me wonder why the powers that be seem to be bringing some of us closer together at this time.

Here is one of my favorite dip recipes.  I got it from a friend at work.

1 block velveeta cheese-mexican flavor
1 block cream cheese
2 cans of Rotel tomatoes (they come in mild or hot-I usually use one of each)
2 cans of your favorite chili

Throw it all in a crockpot on low.  Stir occasionally.  It's usually ready in about an hour.
Serve with chips, veggies, bread or on tacos or burritoes.

I feel the need to vent just a bit...
I have been having a discussion with a co-worker all day about Cinco de Mayo.  I am on a committee that tries to lift morale at work, usually by making some small, seasonal or holiday appropriate gifts to pass out.  I sent out a list with several choices and requested committee members to get back to me with their thoughts, ideas and suggestions.  One committee members response was "I don’t mind doing the May Day Baskets, but Cinco De Mayo is Mexico’s independence day not America’s so I don’t understand why we would celebrate it. If we celebrate it I feel we should celebrate every countries independence day." I basically responded that I know what Cinco de Mayo is and that I had put it on my list because it is very popular here in America.  I also noted a few other holidays that are not really American (by this person's standards).  Valentines Day (Roman saints), St Patrick's Day (the patron saint of Ireland), Mardi Gras (French).  Etc., etc..
Now I am just annoyed and told her that I would take Cinco de Mayo off the list to make her happy.
I can't help but feel that there is a little bit of prejudice on her part here.

I make bath salts every holiday to give as gifts and to make a little extra holiday cash.

Several people have asked for the recipe, so I thought I'd go ahead and post it.

Basic Bath Salt

3 parts Epsom salts
1 part coarse sea salt
1 part rock sea salt

You can use any sea salt you like (or even none at all) but don't use table salt or regular rock salt.  You can also add a handful of baking soda if you like a little fizz in your bath.

To this you can add any combination of essential oils.  More or less oil to your liking.
After mixing the oils to my liking I add a couple drops of food coloring.  When the color is evenly distributed you can be pretty sure that the oils are well mixed also.

Add a couple of spoons or a handful to your bath and enjoy!

Here are a couple of my favorites:

Eucalyptus

1 cup bath salt mix
4 drops eucalyptus essential oil
2 drops each rosemary, thyme, wintergreen essential oils

Lavender Mint

1 cup bath salt mix
4 drops lavender essential oil
2 drops spearmint essential oil

I have to say I had a FANTASTIC holiday week (yup...week)!  That is saying a lot considering my holiday week started with a funeral!

We had our traditional New Year's Party at friends' (who we love and appreciate more than they will ever know) and it was a lot of fun!  Not only were the usual suspects there but we had a couple of friends make it that haven't made it in quite some time...it had been years since some of us were in the same room at the same time (much less in the same state)!  It's certainly been a month of catching up with old friends and making a few new ones!

I am going to make a better effort to stay in touch with friends and family this year (some people I only see at funerals or New Years).

So yesterday (Monday) sucked!
Missed work to take the car in because I had a flat tire.  Ended up buying 4 new tires and getting the car realigned (4 frigging hours and $525 later!).  There is also a CV something blah blah blah that needs to be replaced, but I am doing that next payday.
Left the tire place and stopped for coffee.  Noticed that the brake pedal was very...VERY tight and that the car stopped very quickly.  Thought to myself "it must be the 4 new tires and the realignment".  Came out of coffee shop and could not back out!  Crap!!!  Checked parking brake, not engaged.  Called the auto shop and asked WTF?!!!  The first thing the guy asked me was "is the parking brake on?".  Jackass!  Of course not!  They sent a guy out.  It looks like when they parked my car they had pulled the parking brake so hard that the wire got caught and the brake stayed engaged!
To top it all off my dad said he would put it on his credit card (what a relief) but, he had to go to dialysis so he gave the auto shop guy his info over the phone but when he ran it it didn't work!  I had to pay anyway (crap again!).  There goes the house payment!

Next, I am sitting in my house and I hear a strange sound like branches being dragged through my yard.  I go outside to find my neighbor has cut another huge section out of the fence and he is dragging all these branches into my backyard (he had trimmed his trees).  I'm all "what's going on?"  He tells me that he is going to take care of them he just needed a place to chop them smaller.  WTF?  I told him he'd better take care of it soon.  I don't need any more crap in my yard!  Personally I think he didn't realize that I had taken the day off.
He then proceeded to "help" me with trimming my trees.  This is something I am going to have to talk to him about, he seems to think he can come and go as he pleases on my property.  This is going to be a problem!
More of a problem because on Friday he and his dad came over and hauled away the stairstepper full of wasps and 2 couches for me which was really nice.  I appreciate the help but I think he's overstepping the boundaries here!

I am so glad that day is done!

Today is the first day of October and thus begins my busiest time of year.

Woohoo!  I love October.  Best holday.  Best weather.  Best food.  Best colors.

I have been working on getting my creative juices flowing for several months now, trying to get back to where I was artistically (way, WAY back when).  It's getting easier.  Who knows, I may be able to create something I can make money off!  Ideally, it would be great to be able to make a living doing what I love, sketching, painting, crafting etc..  I am working towards that.

This is also when I start winterizing the house and garden, and start canning.

It's also time to start preparing for the holidays.  YAY!

Doorways.
The doorway is for entering and exiting the room.  It is NOT the meeting place of useless employees to stop and chat.  If you choose to hold court in the doorway expect me to mow your lazy ass down as I am trying to work.

Work.
Work is exactly what it says.  WORK!  It is NOT the place to meet your future boyfriend/girlfriend/spouse etc..  It is not the place to conduct all of your personal business.  It is not the place to do your banking, shopping and dating.  That is what your breaks are for!

Spills.
If you spill it, clean it the F*** up!  This applies to microwave ovens, refridgerators, floors and especially bathrooms!!!

Talking.
Keep it down.  Keep it to a minimum.  Remember that someone is working twice as hard to compensate for your lazy ass, so have the courtesy to keep your mouth in check so that your coworkers can hear themselves think!

Breaks.
Face it...you're getting paid to take an 8 hour break.

***Don't let me interrupt your dicking around with work!***

Clearly someone (yes, me) is having a cranky day at work today!
At least I'm doing my goofing on my break!  Can't say the same for some other people!

It's almost over for the day.  I am sooooooo ready to go home!

I just have to rant for a moment about the economy and politics...I don't know about anyone else but even a trip to the grocery store for essentials kicks my financial ass these days!
I need new tires for my car and I am nowhere close to being able to buy them!
It's damn hard right now for most of us!

My solution...

I think that starting immediately all politicians, congressmen, senators, governors, etc., need to have their salaries adjusted down to the level of the average American citizen!
Instead of voting themselves raises the American people should decide on whether or not they have earned a raise.
I would bet that if the people spending our hard earned dollars had to try to get by on less than two thousand dollars a month, they'd sure as shit find a way to improve the economy, lower taxes, etc..
I would also bet that if their salaries depended on us they'd work alot harder for us!

Or...you can just write me in on the ballot come election day!  :-)

I know that people in America have it much better than other places (and I am so glad to live here).  I just get tired of watching the money flow out of America instead of into America!

When you see this, quote Firefly or Serenity in your livejournal.

"Please God, make me stone"

The bleepin' ground sqirrel is back!
When I came out this morning to go to work there was a nice, new pile of dirt.  Much bigger than before.  I do believe the little shit has thrown down the gauntlet.  Too bad for him I have a long weekend ahead...I have four whole days to spend flooding his ass out!

Of course, it could be a snake...

I can't decide which I'd prefer...I'm not bothered by snakes, but I sure don't want to find one in the bathtub one morning!  Plus, I'd be totally pissed if a snake ate one of my cats!

Either way I don't want to put out any poison that the cats and birds can get to.  I already poisoned the side of my house spraying the wasps!  I'll have to spray them again this weekend too, just to be sure!

Today I am soooo missing my cubicle!  When I first started this job we each had our own cubicle and I loved it.  Then they decided to take out the cubicles and open the office up (they claimed it was to fit more computers in...HAH!).  Many of my co-workers like it better.  But I miss having my own quiet space.  I sat in the middle of people today who did not stop talking...ever!  One gal was either on the phone yapping or talking to one or more co-workers, or doing both simultaneously!  I am amazed she didn't lose her damn voice!  The gals on the other side of me talked to each other and to other co-workers and basically left me to do all the work!  Come to find out I have zero tolerance for lazy co-workers...and even less tolerance for lazy yapping co-workers!
Yah...I'm a little bit irritable today.  Ok...bitchy is probably a better word!
At least if I had my own cubicle I could hear myself think while I'm doing all the work!  Plus, it sucks when you have nosy co-workers who look over your shoulder at everything you do!

Ok!  I feel better!

Grumpy is going back to work now!

I am already excited for Samhain! 
(OK...I was excited for Samhain on Jan 1st!)
Fall is the best time of year, with the best holidays, the best food, the best weather and the best colors!
To make it even better my best friend cronismatplay is going to try to come down for a visit that weekend!
Woohoo!
It's time to start making the Samhain and Harvest crafts and foods!
Right now I am working on making haunted houses out of bird houses.  If they turn out I might even do a few for Yule!
I am also working on pumpkin crepes and baked apple/pumpkin pancakes.  If those recipes turn out I'll post them here.

I have a massive colony of Wasps in my backyard.  They have taken up residence in the old stairstepper (don't ask what that's doing in the backyard...that's a story for another day) which happens to be right under my bedroom window and only a few steps away from the garage door.  Over the summer I guess they have outgrown the stairstepper so they have moved to the fence, the garage and the eaves right above my bedroom window.  I finally decided I need to get rid of them since I can no longer go into the backyard/jungle.  I have successfully poisoned the nest on the fence and the nest on the garage..easy to reach and plenty of room to shoot from a distance and get out of the way.  The one in the eaves of the house however are a little trickier...and I can't even get to the nest in the stairstepper!  I was going to wait it out until winter and then deal with them but the last couple of days the little bastards have started dive bombing me when I go out to get in my car!  Not fun!  So last night I decided to have a go at the eaves nest.  I hid behing the garage and started shooting...edging closer as I fired since I wasn't quite reaching the nest.  When I finally hit it I expected to see what had happened with the other nest...some groggy drunken wasps falling out and crawling out etc...but no...a few wasps shot out of that nest like they were fired from a cannon!  I don't think they even flapped their wings!  And they shot straight at me!  I haven't moved that fast in years!  I ran around the garage through the jungle down the driveway and into the house!  I slammed the door and I tell you...I fully expected to hear kamikazi wasps hitting the other side of it!  I might just have to pay someone to take care of this problem for me!

On the good news side of things I think the feral cats took care of my ground squirrel problem.  I haven't seen hide nor hair of that guy for a couple of weeks now!

As I was channel surfing last night I stumbled accross a comment that really made an impression on me.

Basically it was this:  If you want to be successful you need to make sure that your neighbor is successful.
 
This comment was in referrence to neighboring countries...but I think it applies on the smaller scale as well.  Maybe sometimes our competetive nature (or our bitchy desire to see others fail) gets in the way of our overall success as a species.

Food for thought.

Last weekend I taught myself how to make Mojitos and Margaritas.  I need more lessons so I'm going to try again this weekend... :-)
The best so far:
Mojito:
Make a huge pan of simple syrup (equal parts sugar and water boiled until the sugar dissolves).  Infuse a cup of this with a buttload of fresh mint sprigs (throw them in until the syrup is minty).  Put some mint leaves and sliced limes in a glass.  Cover with syrup.  Squeeze in some lime juice.  Add rum (to taste).  Stir.  Add ice.  Add club soda.  Stir.  Taste.  Add more rum.  Taste.  Squeeze in some more lime juice.  Taste.  And so on until the glass is empty.  Repeat.
Margarita:
Take a cup of the simple syrup (already made from the Mojita adventure).  Add a cup of Rose's sweetened lime juice.  Add a cup of Triple Sec.  Add a cup of Sweet and Sour.  Stir.  Put some sliced limes in a glass.  Cover with syrup.  Add tequila.  Add ice.  Add cranberry juice.  Taste.  Squeeze in some lime juice.  Taste.  Add more tequila.  Taste.  Continue until the glass is empty.  Repeat.

I have to say...nothing wakes your ass up like a little shakin' in the morning!
I was watching the news and drinking my morning coffee when all of a sudden my couch started shaking!  I thought it was just the garbage truck until my wind chimes started tinkling and my couch started moving from side to side.  My cats were looking at me with that "WTF?!  Should we run?" expression...and it hit me...earthquake!
I'm very happy that my rickety little house didn't fall on me!
There have been a few aftershocks that I didn't feel...probably because I am now at work and it would take a lot more shaking to feel anything in this building!  Hopefully there won't be anything more severe than we have already had today.

I was thinking the other day about what awesome friends I have.  I decided to make a list of some of the things my friends have done for me and for each other over the years.

Rides to and from work when the car is broken.
Cutting trees down in the yard.
Giving money.
Giving time.
Showing up when emotional support is needed.
Giving up weekends to help out.
Moving furniture.
Cleaning house (especially those high up places).
Giving advice and not getting mad if/when it is ignored.
Hugs.
Acceptance...tolerance... :-)
Help with computers...again and again and again.
Keeping company at the doctor's office.
Stepping in front of a loaded shotgun.
Washing/waxing the car.

There isn't room for everything...but I know my world is a much better place because of my friends (and honestly I might not be here if it wasn't for my friends).

It really sucks when your sinus pain is so severe that you don't realize some of that pain in your jaw is actually a broken tooth!
Tuesday: I discovered my broken tooth...while at work...AFTER the dentist had closed for the day!
Wednesday: I took the day off to go to the dentist for tooth repair...I need a ROOT CANAL!  And by the way, the new and improved stronger anesthetic still doesn't do didley!  Luckily my dentist believes in the happy gas!  (Bite your dentist one time and forever after he won't dare stick his hand in your mouth without subduing you with laughing gas first).
Next Wednesday:  root canal with a specialist.
Next Thursday:  2 caps and a replacement filling.
And that will take care of one quadrant...they want me to come back in November for a cleaning and to find out what else needs replacing.  Waaahhh!  I don't like to go to the dentist!
My fangs will be sore for weeks!

I think I deserve some spoiling this weekend (and I definitely deserve spoiling NEXT weekend)!

Well I finally made it out the the yard this weekend and thanks to my friend Apostate_96 and his machete o' cleaving I can actually see the ground in my backyard!  The other nice thing about taking out a small jungle is that I don't worry about what might be hiding back there...I have a huge yard and when it is full of trees and catnip (yes, catnip does grow taller than me when left to it's own devices) it is a haven for all sorts of critters (real and imaginary :-) ).

We topped that off by watching a couple of movies.  Jet Li.  Ahhhh!!!!.

Then Sunday dinner with the family.  Which in my case means dinner with 40 or more depending on how many of the kids bring dates!  My siblings take turns hosting the monthly Sunday dinner at their homes and everyone brings a dish.  Except for me...I'm the poorest so they don't usually ask me to bring food...although sometimes they forget to tell me about the parties!  They make all the announcements at these dinners and if you miss one then you miss out on all the family news and the time and place of future parties.  Once they forgot to tell me that my sister-in-law was pregnant.  I was very suprised at Christmas to have a new nephew!  Now that my sister has moved out of state I miss out because she was the one who always called with the updates!  This is what happens with a huge family...everyone assumes somebody else took care of things!

I was tagged by Apostate_96 

1. Leave me a comment saying anything random, likeyour favorite lyric to your current favorite song. Or your favoritekind of sandwich. Something random. Whatever you like. 
2. I respond by asking you five personal questions so I can get to know you better. 
3. You WILL (if you really wanna) update your LJ with the answers to the questions. 
4. You will (again, if you really wanna) include this explanation and offer to ask someone else in the post. 
5. When others comment asking to be asked, you will (one last time, if you really, REALLY wanna) ask them five questions. 

1. Why did you start smoking? 
The truthful answer is twofold. First: my highschool sweetie that I dated for 7 years told me if I ever cut my hair or smoked he'd break up with me...after our mutual breakup I cut my hair and soon after took up smoking. Second: it turned out that smoking was a surefire icebreaker. More than anything out there! How sad is that? 
2. How did you meet Steve? 
I met Steve when I started working at Barnes and Noble. Also where I first met Charlie and Jim. What a great choice that job was! 
3. Have you ever really wanted to marry someone? 
The short answer is yes. 
4. What do you really want to do for a job/career? 
Author. Artist. Dictator. 
5. Do you ever feel lonely? 
Occasionally. Usually it's when I miss someone who's no longer available...like my mom. I'm generally pretty content to be in my own space. Sometimes I really, really miss people...like friends who are far away...but I don't consider that to be loneliness.

Wow! It's been too long since I wrote anything! 
Here's a quickie catch up. 
We finally got our upgrade at work (which works out to .63 more per hourish for me) but, yay anyway because every penny helps! 

I've been sick for the last few months. It started as a sinus infection, which got worse and worse and that led to a urinary tract infection from hell. That was great fun since the doc pulled out the big guns (because they found red and white blood cells in the urine) and gave me something really strong...which I turned out to be allergic to. After spending several days looking like Rocky Balboa after the fight the swelling finally went down. The second medicine didn't work at all. It was good ol' penicillin that finally did the trick. 
The sinus infection never really left (thanks to the wonderful smokey air we have here in Utah) but, it's eased a bit and I'm happy with that for now. 
I had to have a nerve conductivity test done because my arm kept falling asleep. I say it's a pinched nerve. After the test found nothing the doc tends to agree with me. I took a couple of courses of anti-inflammatory meds and that has helped alot! 

My dad fell getting out of the tub. Thank god my nephew was there and found him! He's currently in a facility getting physical therapy so he can walk. I may have to move in with him. This stuff is happening way to often! 

I finally got central air (and just in time)! Woohoo! I may have to get a second job just to pay for running it though...because now that I have it...I USE it!!! 

And...there is a dead cat in my crawlspace! Not one of mine! But I am physically unable to crawl in there and get it out...so there it sits! I'll have to bribe one of my wonderful friends to crawl in there and pull it out for me! 

I think that pretty much catches me up.

We received news this morning that another coworker has died.
He went to California for his brother's wedding and died there.  He wasn't feeling well for some time before he left but he didn't want to miss the wedding.  It appears that he died from pneumonia.
WTF is going on around here?!

Today is a bad day at work.
They called us all in to the office and sat us down and I was thinking we were in for an ass chewing until the Lieutenant started passing around the tissues.
Turns out they found one of my coworkers dead in her bed this morning!
She was only 33 years old!
This makes the third person at work to die this month...I hope that's the end of it!

Well it got above 40 degrees this weekend so I spent some time working out in the yard...cutting, trimming, cleaning etc.  The sun was shining and I actually got some color (okay...could have been over exertion)!  I was so happy!
Then I woke up this morning to a white monday!  Crap!
Good thing I didn't turn the furnace off yesterday when I thought about it!
So...it's snowing and it's Monday...of course that means when I get to work and step out of my car I step into 3 inches of slush!
Cold, wet, dirty slush!  Now I have wet feet!
And of course, it's a holiday.  Work is so slow!  I think I'll beat myself unconcious on my desk!
Did I also mention that it's snowing?  Bah!

The real bummer this weekend has been all the avalanche deaths...6 last I heard...here in Utah.  We're not having a bad enough year as it is...let's add some more trauma to it!  I'm once again afraid to turn on my television...every time I do it's death, dying, murder, accident...

On the plus side...Britney Spears went a little nuts and shaved her head...I have to admit I got a little bit of a giggle out of that.  Seriously though...I think she's gone 'round the bend and probably needs a hand finding all of her marbles.

Enough bitching for now I think!  ...maybe...

Last week I was home sick for a couple of days (still trying to shake the gumbo from the previous week).  This cold, dry weather combined with the inversion from hell is kicking my butt!  So, Tuesday I finally drag myself out of bed to make some toast...I look out the kitchen window to see the snowstorm o' doom raging away!  At least I was home sick and didn't have to drive in it!  I plop myself down on the couch with my toast and coffee and watch a movie, sleep some more etc.  Later that afternoon I get up and look out to see how much snow we got...and to my surprise (and joy) someone has shoveled my driveway and sidewalk!  I still don't know who it was but it was an awesome surprise!  Of course, I'm a little worried that I didn't see or hear a thing (you'd think a body would notice someone out there shoveling the walks)!

This week I am feeling much better, but I'm so ready for Spring!  It doesn't help that the stores have started putting out all of their garden goodies and everyone is sending out the seed and garden catalogs!  I'm ready to start planting now!

A small list of things I'm thankful for.
Friends.  I have some amazing friends!
Family.
Animal companions...they are way more than pets!
My job and the fact that I am able to work.
My health...despite a few problems it's pretty good.
Books.
Movies.
Imagination.
Chocolate.
Coffee.
Autumn.
Halloween.
Rain.
Music.

I'm thankful that I still have the ability to enjoy so many of the things I love! I can see, I can hear, I can draw, I can walk and I can sing (much to the dismay of my coworkers!)

I'm sitting on the couch with my feet up sipping my coffee and watching CSI New York with the kitties when all of a sudden I get that feeling of being watched...then both cats sit up and look at the doorway leading into the kitchen...ears pricked forward and alert.  TV gets muted...don't hear anything...but I can't help remember the night a few years ago when I was trying to get to sleep but every time I closed my eyes I felt someone sit on my bed!  The next morning I was telling my roomie about this and she got the strangest look on her face and said "let me tell you what I saw last night".  She proceeded to tell me that she saw a young man walk down the hall and through (yes THROUGH) my bedroom door.  So I'm wondering if my guest is back.  This is the guy that used to tease my friends by poking his head around the doorway when they watched tv and then pulling back as soon as they looked over!
I always check out what the cats are looking at because their senses are better than mine.  They know when someone is outside before I do.  It's a little unnerving however when there is nothing tangible to be setting them off!

So last week I pull into my driveway after another long day at work only to notice that my door is ajar...with a bigass crack in it!
You guessed it!  While I was away at work some jerks kicked my door in and robbed me!  I don't know what's worse...the expense of replacing the door, the loss of property, or the loss of security...the feeling of violation.  Someone I don't know was in my home...in MY BEDROOM...I run the gamut from sadness to rage and back again.
Fortunately the kids are fine if not a bit shaken (every loud noise outside scares them and big noises completely panic them!)  I think they'll be jumpy for awhile.  Poor babies!
Yet another reason I want my own island!

From my pal apostate_96.

Ask me 3 to 5 questions, no more no less. Ask me anything you want and I will answer them as honestly and completely as I can. Then, if you want to, go to your journal, copy and paste this, allowing your friends (including me) to ask you anything. IF you want to, no peer pressure.

Your comments may or may not be screened, depending on what you ask. Same with your answers.

I just have to get this off my mind.

I am soooooo tired of hearing about how Mel Gibson is such a bad person for his anti-sematic "tirade" to a cop!
First of all who hasn't made rude comments in the heat of the moment and regretted it later?  It's not like he was on stage at the Oscars or in some public forum...it was comments to a police officer who had just pulled him over!
Second I can't help but think if some average Joe off the street had made those same comments the officer would have just shrugged it off as another obnoxious drunk.
Third Mel has apologized repeatedly.  Forgive and forget people!
And last but not least...shouldn't we be MORE upset that Mr. Gibson was driving under the influence?

It's not cool to be making antisematic remarks but at least it's legal!  People are allowed to have an opinion...granted he probably should have chosen better circumstances in which to express himself but maybe he was provoked!  I don't know I wasn't there.  I just think we should be complaining about the DUI instead of the big mouth!

I was watching 60 minutes the other day and they had a story about an employer who fired people for smoking.  The employer gave his employees 15 months to quit smoking and then anyone who tested positive for nicotine would be fired.  Believe it or not this is perfectly legal.  Apparently there are companies all over the US that refuse to hire smokers.  The justification is that it lowers their medical costs.  Personally I think it is just another excuse to A)pick on smokers and B)impose their own lifestyle preferences on another.  It makes me wonder where we'll be in 20 years.  Your employer can determine what you eat (no fatties allowed), what you drink (no coffee, tea or alcohol please), what you do in your spare time (exercise every day...no couch potatoes here) and probably who you sleep with (we all know where that's going).  It stuns me that a person can be fired for doing something legal on their own time.  According to the 60 Minutes story "under the law in all but five states in America, your boss can fire you for any reason under the sun.  Including who you associate with after work.  Whether you're smoking or drinking in your own home.  Or a bumper sticker on your car.  And you have no legal recourse."
I don't smoke anymore, but I do other things that could be considered unhealthy and it would totally piss me off if my boss tried to make me stop doing any of them!
Well, nuff said for now.

I have a recurring dream...well the stuff that happens isn't always the same...but it's about the same place.  I dream about a house in the mountains.  It's always the same house.  The road is always the same.  The neighborhood (as far as you can call it a neighborhood) is the same.  I'm always there with 1 or more of my circle of friends.  It is always night.  There is always some kind of stormy weather, either rain, or snow, last night it was hail.  There is always wind blowing.  In last night's installment I was with a couple of friends at a picnic area (yes, at night).  We were BBQing and it started to hail so we were huddled under a tree.  The wind started picking up so we made a dash through the woods for the car.  We were running along this dirt path dodging hailstones and tree bits (the moon was out so we could see pretty good).  We finally made it to the car and started driving down the road and this is where it's always the same.  I'm in a car with someone on this same road and at the same bend in the road I wake up.  Every time.
I haven't figured out what it means, if anything.  It's so familiar to me though.  I recognize the place and it doesn't seem familiar just from my dreams, it's familiar from my memories.

Evil is a matter of perspective.
I made this comment to a coworker and immediately another coworker jumped in with "What about Hitler?".  Aaargh!  The frustration of being asked for my point of view to defend a comment about perspective.  Duh!
It all stems from an RPG adventure many years ago in which half of the players were aligned with the "bad" guys and half were aligned with the "good" guys.  We spent a lot of time trying to convince each other that ours was the side to be on.  My friend and I would talk about it after each gaming session (often at work) and had pretty much the same experience with everyone (outside of our gaming group) in that they would bring up the most vile person they could think of to convince us that our opinion was in error.
I think that everything is a matter of perspective and it's actually quite difficult to really understand another person's point of view simply because our thinking is always colored by our own perspective.
Had to get it out of my system because I just spent an hour listening to my coworkers argue about how to do a new task and a lot of the argument consisted of "I know but...", "but we need this because..." etc., etc..  Everyone was only thinking about what they had to do and nobody was looking at the whole picture.  So of course it got me thinking about the old perspective discussion!
**making a mental note to be more considerate of what other people are really saying**
